DataElement.preferredName: American Cancer Society Patient Reported Outcome Case Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Unique identifier used to identify cases in an American Cancer Society Patient Reported Outcome study, and intended for use in the Rapid Quality Reporting System (RQRS)

DataElementConcept.preferredName: American Cancer Society Patient Reported Outcome Case Identification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A nationwide, community-based voluntary health organization, the largest private source of cancer research funds in the U.S. Headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, the ACS has state divisions and more than 3,400 local offices. ACS provides information on cancer incidence, mortality, causes, manifestations, treatment, and prevention, as well as on cancer research and clinical trials, and promotes beneficial policies, laws, and regulations for patients and families affected by cancer._Information collected directly from a patient that typically includes subjective feelings regarding symptons, functions in daily life, physical, mental, emotional, spiritual, and social well being, and satisfaction with his/her health care._A problem requiring investigation._Identified; having the identity known or established.

ObjectClass.preferredName: American Cancer Society Patient Reported Outcome
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A nationwide, community-based voluntary health organization, the largest private source of cancer research funds in the U.S. Headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, the ACS has state divisions and more than 3,400 local offices. ACS provides information on cancer incidence, mortality, causes, manifestations, treatment, and prevention, as well as on cancer research and clinical trials, and promotes beneficial policies, laws, and regulations for patients and families affected by cancer.:Information collected directly from a patient that typically includes subjective feelings regarding symptons, functions in daily life, physical, mental, emotional, spiritual, and social well being, and satisfaction with his/her health care.

Concepts.definition: A nationwide, community-based voluntary health organization, the largest private source of cancer research funds in the U.S. Headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, the ACS has state divisions and more than 3,400 local offices. ACS provides information on cancer incidence, mortality, causes, manifestations, treatment, and prevention, as well as on cancer research and clinical trials, and promotes beneficial policies, laws, and regulations for patients and families affected by cancer.

Information collected directly from a patient that typically includes subjective feelings regarding symptoms, functions in daily life, physical, mental, emotional, spiritual, and social well being, and satisfaction with his/her health care.

Property.preferredDefinition: A problem requiring investigation.:Identified; having the identity known or established.

Concepts.definition: The procedure of having an identity established.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.
evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
